reports.title: Trend Spotlight: Gluten Free
reports.description:
With colder temperatures, things are about to get a lot more homey. As outdoor eating spaces begin to close, delivery and home cooking, now the standards for much of the food and beverage industry, will be more relevant than ever.

Enter our analysis of gluten-free trends, a fascinating case study for the techniques, strategies, and data sources that will be crucial this season. 

Some of the questions we answer in our latest report: 

- Why do today's consumers turn towards gluten-free food and beverage?
- What white spaces exist in foodservice surrounding gluten-free trends?
- How can companies leverage gluten-free motivations for their product marketing?
reports.AboutTastewise:
Tastewise fuels innovation for the world’s leading food & beverage brands by predicting how consumers cook, order, and eat. No guesswork, no outdated reports.

Using proprietary AI, Tastewise holistically measures consumer relationships to food and beverage. Used by industry leaders, our insights - a fusion of social media, restaurant menus, and recipes -  inform product development, marketing strategy, and sales execution.
reports.quote_content: In a rapidly changing landscape, how can CPGs, foodservice, manufacturers and others understand the choices consumers are making at home?
reports.bubble_2_product_2: GF Recipes that Feature Functional Benefits

reports.title: The 2021 Flavor Innovation Guide
reports.description:
Download the 2021 Flavor Innovation Guide to learn how you can use data to build an exciting and successful flavor library. All data was collected through the Tastewise Insights, the Food Intelligence Platform used by some of the world's largest brands and flavor companies. 

Questions this guide can help you answer:
- What's the best condiment for vegans right now?
- What flavors are most closely aligned with immunity?
- What are the emerging trends of Fall 2020 to keep tabs on, and how can they help inform your process?
- What flavor will moms love the most in 2021?
reports.AboutTastewise:
Tastewise fuels innovation for the world’s leading food & beverage brands by predicting how consumers cook, order, and eat. No guesswork, no outdated reports.

Using proprietary AI, Tastewise holistically measures consumer relationships to food and beverage. Used by industry leaders, our insights - a fusion of social media, restaurant menus, and recipes -  inform product development, marketing strategy, and sales execution.
reports.quote_content: Any and all flavor ideas that are presented internally and to customers require data to support them before facing clients. But with millions of people posting about food and interacting with online recipes every day, how do you keep up -- let alone harness all this data to your advantage?

reports.title: Plant-Based Trends 2020
reports.descriptionTitle: What is going on in the plant-based food & beverage space?
reports.description:
A bite-sized preview of the latest trends: 

- Personal health outweighs planetary health for the majority of plant-based eaters
- Trending functional needs are intimately personal - the pandemic pushes consumers to seek healthcare from food 
- Plant-based dairy shines in restaurants, but consumers are craving meat

How can food and beverage industry players tap into these emerging trends -in July, 2020 and beyond? Download the full report for more.
reports.AboutTastewise:
Tastewise fuels innovation for the world’s leading food & beverage brands by predicting how consumers cook, order, and eat. No guesswork, no outdated reports.

Using proprietary AI, Tastewise holistically measures consumer relationships to food and beverage. Used by industry leaders, our insights - a fusion of social media, restaurant menus, and recipes -  inform product development, marketing strategy, and sales execution.
reports.quote_content: Animal rights and sustainability are decreasing as drivers for eating plant-based. Our Plant-Based Food Trends Report details not only what plant-based categories are trending, but *why*.

reports.title: Functional Foods: Revisited
reports.description:
Last September, we took a look at the nascent era of functional foods. Now, nearly a year later, the world has changed.

What has changed in the functional food & beverage space? 

A bite-sized look at some of our findings: 
- Today, recipes addressing functional needs are used 1.5x more than those that don't  
- The fastest rising functional needs are medicinal, with Eastern spices offering popular value 

How can food and beverage industry players tap into these emerging trends -in July, 2020 and beyond? Download the report for the full look at these insights and more.

Using proprietary AI, Tastewise holistically measures consumer relationships to food and beverage. Used by industry leaders, our insights - a fusion of social media, restaurant menus, and recipes -  inform product development, marketing strategy, and sales execution.
reports.quote_content: 50% of all dining occasions center on the functionality of food - up from 33% last year. Our Functional Foods: Revisited report takes a look at what else has changed in the functional food space, and how CPGs, restaurants, and more can plug in.

reports.title: UK Food Trends 2020
reports.descriptionTitle: What ingredients, dishes, and motivations are driving the UK's food & beverage scene in 2020?
reports.description:
- Create laser sharp marketing plans based on geography: Brighton shows more vegan interest than London, and geographic opportunities abound. 

- Activate your R&D innovation with insights into trending niche ingredients. L-theanine is skyrocketing in popularity as a replacement for CBD's stress relieving qualities; sweet and spicy Gochujang is poised to take over the hot sauce market.

Download the full report for an in-depth look at these trends and so much more.
reports.AboutTastewise:
Tastewise fuels innovation for the world’s leading food & beverage brands by predicting how consumers cook, order, and eat. No guesswork, no outdated reports.

Using proprietary AI, Tastewise holistically measures consumer relationships to food and beverage. Used by industry leaders, our insights - a fusion of social media, restaurant menus, and recipes -  inform product development, marketing strategy, and sales execution.
reports.quote_content: Consumers in Brighton are 2x more interested in vegan food and beverage than Londoners, while Welsh interest eclipses that of the English by 13%. Our UK Trends Report 2020 investigates the biggest food trends in the UK, and the motivations behind them.

reports.title: American Sweet Tooth: Sweetener Trends
reports.description:
Although consumer interest in sweetners is only increasing every year, restaurants and recipes are not paying the category enough attention. 

- there is a 16% gap between supply and demand in recipes using sweeteners
- only ~6% of restaurants highlight natural sweeteners on their menus, despite significant demand
- monk fruit shows promise as America's most trending sugar alternative 

How can manufacturers and restaurants tap into emerging sweetener trends -in May, 2020 and beyond? Download the report for the full look at the sweetest trends in today's market.

Tastewise fuels innovation for the world’s leading food & beverage brands by predicting how consumers cook, order, and eat. No guesswork, no outdated reports.

Using proprietary AI, Tastewise holistically measures consumer relationships to food and beverage. Used by industry leaders, our insights - a fusion of social media, restaurant menus, and recipes -  inform product development, marketing strategy, and sales execution.
test
reports.quote_content: There is a 16% gap between supply and demand in recipes using sweeteners, leaving the 142M Americans that crave sugar alternatives in the lurch. Our sweetener trends report details the actionable ways food service and CPG players can tap into this $21.5B sweet spot.

reports.title: Rise and Shine: Breakfast Trends
reports.description:
The most important meal of the day is up **+13% YoY** in popularity among consumers nationwide. Restaurants, however, aren’t joining the breakfast buzz; breakfast menu listings are down **-5%** in the last year.

What motivations are driving people to their favorite breakfast dishes? And how can food and beverage industry players tap into emerging breakfast trends -in June, 2020 and beyond? 

Download the full report, created in collaboration with the Dairy Alliance, for more.

reports.quote_content: Interest in meal-kits for breakfast is up +291% among American consumers. Consumer interest in breakfast is increasing, and restaurants and recipes would do well to pay the category attention - our latest trend report gives actionable insights into *how*.

reports.title: Ice, Shake, Netflix, Chill: Cocktail Kit Trends
reports.descriptionTitle: A $74B opportunity lies within today's rapidly growing cocktail kit trend.
reports.description:
People want delivery-friendly alternatives to date nights, happy hours, and eating out in quarantine. Food & beverage kits are the answer - and in a beverage industry that's frozen, that opportunity is worth a lot. 

How can CPGs and food service tap into the emerging cocktail kit trend, in May, 2020 and beyond? Download the full report for an in-depth look at today's cocktail kit trend - and where it is heading tomorrow.

reports.quote_content: Everyone's a mixologist in quarantine, and consumers are looking for the next great ingredient for their at-home cocktail. With interest in delivery exploding (+1,1485% in the last few months!), how can food service and CPG players tap into a lucrative opportunity for cocktail kits?

reports.title: Responding to the Rise in Home Cooking
reports.descriptionTitle: Home Cooking in the time of COVID-19
reports.description:
Instances of caregivers cooking with kids is up **+38%** in the last few weeks of March/April alone. 

Download our report to learn what you need to know about the millions of parents cooking at home during COVID-19. 

Use this report to:

- Better understand a time sensitive white space

- Support your consumers

- Refine your targeted marketing

reports.quote_content: Interest in comfort foods for kids is up +76% among caregivers at home. Our latest report, Responding to the Rise in Home Cooking, offers actionable insights into how food industry players can meet a growing - and urgent - need for kitchen-friendly foods that meet both kids' and parents' needs.

reports.title: Food & Beverage Sustainability Trends 2020
reports.descriptionTitle: Ready to create sustainable food and beverage products in 2020, backed by real-time data?
reports.description:
A sneak peak at our latest report's findings:  

- Consumers eat sustainably for their health, before environmental considerations
- Though vegan is the top diet for sustainability-minded consumers, meat still reigns for some audiences
- Sustainable seafood dominates today's restaurant kitchens - and home kitchens

How do sustainability trends like these impact your category? Enter your email and you'll get the report directly in your inbox, featuring the above insights and a whole lot more.

reports.quote_content: In 39% of all sustainably-sourced dining occasions, consumers focus on the health benefits of their food. Our Sustainability Trends 2020 Report details the sustainability trends - and the motivations behind them - to expect in 2020.

reports.title: Putting Food to Work in the Age of Wellness
reports.descriptionTitle: What foods & beverages are addressing today's most pressing needs?
reports.description:
A bite-sized look at the top trends influencing F&B at the end of 2019:

- The dominating diet of fall/winter, 2019: Veganism

- The fasting rising diet of fall/winter, 2019: Carnivore Diet

- The fastest falling diet of fall/winter, 2019: Clean Eating

Download the report for the full insights.
